name: Outer Isles Archipelago
economy_niches: harvest/processing of ritual reagents (seaweeds, sponges, resins)
pilotage and augury services for coastal trade
seasonal salt and kelp cottage industry
culture_adjustments: stronger clan-guild autonomy; local captains override distant sea-law
oral ballads focus on single-ship sagas and island-origin myths
practical, short-range auguries specialized for local channels
heavier Island Creole lexical influence in everyday speech
communal boat-sheds and collective labor rites for ship-launches
constraints: reliance on imported bulky reagents for high-demand rituals
notes: key source of pilots, charts, and low-tonnage coastal craft
population fluxes seasonally with fishing and salting cycles
